alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Metro Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Broward County through 430 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wilton Manors, or over Fort Lauderdale, moving northeast at 5 tp 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Pompano Beach, Tamarac, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale, Lauderdale Lakes, Wilton Manors, Sea Ranch Lakes, Lazy Lake, Village Park, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Franklin Park, Twin Lakes, Golden Heights, Palm Aire, Washington Park, Port Everglades, Chula Vista and Broadview-Pompano Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Miami. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Metro Broward County
